page.title: 10THE YEW TREE GARDEN,LYDART
page.content: The garden of one hectare has been developed since 1955,although some trees are clearly much older. The actual 'yew tree' is very old,and is now reduced to a leafy globe which, with a wintry cap of snow,looks like a traditional Christmas pudding. The acid soil is ideal for heathers, rhododendrons and ericaceous plants. The garden has a great variety of maturing rare,unusual trees and shrubs as well as choice plants in beds,stone troughs and rockeries. From the depths of winter with witch- hazel and hellebores in flower,there is a constant succession of flowers and foliage changes until the waning days of autumn produce brilliant colour in maples and mountain ashes. Indeed,the Yew Tree is a garden for all seasons,and every year brings dis- appointments,successes and surprises.
